addTokenAddress(address).details: can only be called by owner

params._savingsAccount: address of the savings account contract*
params._treasury: address of the TREASURY where tokens are sent in case of emergencies

params._amount: amount to be withdraw. (if 0, it means all amount)
params._asset: address of the token being withdrawn

returns._0: amount of shares for given tokens*

getTokensForShares(uint256,address).details: Used to get amount of underlying tokens for given number of shares

returns._0: address of the lqiudity token for the asset*

lockTokens(address,address,uint256).details: Asset Tokens to be locked must be approved to this contract by user

params.asset: the address of token to invest

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeTokenAddress(address).details: can only be called by owner

params._asset: address of token to remove from whitelist*

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.amount: the amount of shares to unlock

returns._0: tokensReceived received amount of tokens received*

SAVINGS_ACCOUNT().notice: stores the address of savings account contract*

addTokenAddress(address).notice: used to whitelist token to be deposited in noYield

emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256).notice: used to withdraw all tokens of a type in case of emergencies

getSharesForTokens(uint256,address).notice: Used to get number of shares from an amount of underlying tokens

initialize(address).notice: used to initialize the variables in the contract

liquidityToken(address).notice: used to query liquidity token for a given asset

lockTokens(address,address,uint256).notice: Used to lock tokens in the protocol

removeTokenAddress(address).notice: used to remove token from whitelist

unlockTokens(address,address,uint256).notice: Used to unlock tokens from the protocol

documentation.text: @notice stores the address of savings account contract*

@notice emitted when a token is whitelisted to be deposited
 @param asset address of the token to be whitelisted

@notice emitted when a token is removed from whitelist
 @param asset address of the token being removed from whitelist
@notice checks if contract is invoked by savings account*
